article_title: Catastrophic Health Care fund costs drop, but will trend continue?

article_metadata.title: Catastrophic Health Care fund costs drop, but will trend continue? | Idaho Statesman

og.description: Idaho’s Catastrophic Health Care Program is how the state covers medical expenses for people who can’t pay when they get hit with huge medical bills. Last year, the state set aside nearly $35 million for those costs.
